translated: so may your nose grow back,
give me a lotus, I beg you.”
“Just as a seed sown in season,
when planted, grows in the field,
so may your nose grow back,
give me a lotus, I beg you.”

original: Vajjuṁ vā te na vā vajjuṁ,
analyzed: vajjum vā te na vā vajju
translated: Whether it will grow or not,
there is no growing back of the nose;
The Lotus Birth Story, the first.
